properties.Mission: We offer aerial arts for students as young as 18 months through adult
A quiet place for meditation, reflection and retreat; a garden portraying the passion and life history of Jesus Christ.
Beautiful terraced gardens, expansive vistas, and peace of mind await all those who visit Crystal Hermitage.

Arts For The Schools is a bi-state 501(c)3 non profit that fundamentally believes that access and exposure to the arts is essential for all.  Arts For The Schools fills the gaps in visual and performing arts education for more than 10,000 children at K thru 12 schools AND provides access to artistic excellence for the public.

Banner Mountain Artisans was started in 2004 by Joan Unter when she asked 16 creative artisans from Grass Valley, Penn Valley and Nevada City to offer their artwork at a holiday show. The first event was held in 6 homes in close proximity on Banner Mountain, Nevada City. More quality artists were added each year, and in 4 years the attendance exceeded all expectations and outgrew the neighborhood. Banner Mountain Artisans had built a reputation offering diverse, quality handmade gifts, all sold in beautiful homes among the towering trees.
We are committed to bringing a diverse array of programming to western Nevada County, including music, dance, theater, film, visual art, comedy, youth arts education and literature.

Center Stage Dance Studio is a full spectrum dance and theatre studio offering classes in Ballet, Pointe, Tap, Jazz, Hip Hop, Contemporary, Pre Dance, Pilates, Children’s Theatre and more. Our experienced teaching staff creates a safe, supportive environment for every student to achieve their full potential.
The Coburn Music Festival is an adventurous and innovative early music festival that aims to bring the Tahoe Truckee basin to the forefront of the classical music scene.

properties.Organization: Community of Writers at Squaw Valley
properties.Mission: For 47 summers, the Community of Writers at Squaw Valley has brought together poets and prose writers for separate weeks of workshops, individual conferences, lectures, panels, readings, and discussions of the craft and the business of writing. Our aim is to assist writers in the refinement of their craft and thus, in an atmosphere of camaraderie and mutual support, move them closer to achieving their goals.

properties.Organization: Foothill Country Dancers/Country Dance & Song Society
properties.Mission: Foothill Country Dancers (FCD) is a small, volunteer-run non profit organization dedicated to promoting contra dancing in the foothills zone of Nevada and Placer counties.

We Are a spiritually focused, culturally diverse and socially conscious independent film company. Addressing the wounds inflicted by institutionalized stereotypes and fundamentalist doctrines and beliefs.
We are a group of male singers in the Sierra Foothills of California. We gather to share our love of music in the spirit of the Grass Valley Cornish gold miners of long ago.
Grass Valley Taiko was established in 2000 by Founder and Artistic Director Mitzi Garnett from a basic one-time workshop that grew into the multiple classes of varied levels that exist now.

The mission of Haute Trash is to create and produce performance art of the highest professional quality and to perform it before the broadest possible audience. We create fashion out of trash in order to entertain,educate and empower others to think,reuse and recycle.

To offer systematic classical ballet curriculum from beginning levels to pre professional levels. To foster the artistic development of all students in the musicality and interpretation of ballet as a performing art. To deliver instruction based on the best current practices in safe physical training and practical performing skills. To mentor each student in personal goals in ballet, whether as a profession, a college scholarship and degree, or a rewarding hobby. To create dancers who move with joy and passion.
Using the power of dance and music to cultivate life skills in our youth, promote global stewardship and create an everlasting passion for the arts.

A music forum where teens can play a variety of musical instruments on stage, as well as, offer safe space exclusively for teens ages 13 thru 17. We offer positive experiences of connectedness, ethics, spirituality, etiquette, and citizenship through activities, events, and the positive expression of the arts.

LeGacy Productions is a family owned and operated small business theater company based in Nevada County, California. We are dedicated to providing an affordable and meaningful theater experience for our community.   We also provide an opportunity to those who like to work hard, have fun and contribute to the quality of life in Nevada County and the surrounding regions.

The Miners Foundry Cultural Center is a living historic treasure serving Nevada County as a cultural arts and community events center.  More than a venue, the nonprofit’s mission is to preserve, enhance and utilize the historic Miners Foundry for cultural, educational and social activities in Nevada County.
Music in the Mountains inspires and engages community members of all ages by providing access to extraordinary classical music through performances and youth education programs.

Everyone needs a job, a place to find purpose and meaning in their life. For many Developmentally Disabled or Intellectually Challenged adults living in Nevada County, CA, that place is the Neighborhood Center of the Arts. We provide studios, materials and instruction in fiber arts, visual arts, clay, woodworking, jewelry, computers and performing arts as well as cooking, gardening and community outings.
A studio that is committed to providing careful, correct ballet training to students in a safe, non-competitive and comfortable atmosphere,

NCFF screens almost 100 films, including comedies, dramas, documentaries, animation, and international shorts, in a variety of historic locations in downtown Nevada City. By combining creative programming of short and full length films, enthusiastic audiences and a truly festive environment, NCFF has become known as one of the most innovative, fun and artist-friendly events on the film festival circuit. In addition to creating a one of a kind experience for both the audience and filmmaker, NCFF offers terrific opportunities to network and forum.
We facilitate collaborative efforts that promote and sustain the visual, literary and performing arts of Nevada County to advance the cultural, social and economic life of our community
The Nevada County Composers Cooperative exists to foster the creation and performance of new original music

Located in Grass Valley, California, the Nevada County Fairgrounds has been declared as California’s Most Beautiful Fairgrounds, and is covered with hundreds of towering pine trees on almost 90 acres.  It is home to the annual Nevada County Fair, the Draft Horse Classic, the Country Christmas Faire, world class music festivals, and year round community events. There is also a year round RV Park, Lions Lake, rental facilities, weekly events, weddings, some of our community’s largest outdoor events, and lots of areas to walk.
Our mission at the Nevada County Fairgrounds Foundation is simple: to build a better Nevada County Fairgrounds through fundraising and contributions to the Fairgrounds.

The Nevada County Gem and Mineral Society is a non profit organization that has the following objectives:  To promote the study of mineralogy, geology, and fossils.  To encourage the collection of minerals and gems. To foster the study and practice of the lapidary arts.  To provide field trips to mineral localities.  To promote good fellowship, education and recreation.
We provide a quality Children’s Theatre Program for our Nevada County youth.
Nevada Union Art Guild is a collaborative association of students, faculty, and parents that exists to maintain and promote the Nevada Union High School Fine Art Department.

The mission of the North Columbia Schoolhouse Cultural Center is to inspire and educate our community by providing a venue for gatherings, performance, art and education that enriches and sustains our rural character and traditions.

FUN is the key word at Off Broad St. Our goal is to bring you an unforgettable evening of entertainment. We produce only comedies, and most of these are musicals, with a slant toward familiar hit songs of the 1950s and 60s. Intimate cabaret seating and a relaxed and friendly atmosphere add to the uniqueness of the experience.

United by a love of music, the OLLI orchestra is a group of diverse musicians who rehearse and perform classical music. Some are retired professional musicians; some are completely new to orchestra.  The OLLI Orchestra provides an opportunity for musicians to extend and push themselves while having great fun playing with a group.

properties.Organization: Onstage Live (by Arts for the Schools)
properties.Mission: Arts For The Schools is a bi state 501(c)3 non profit that fundamentally believes that access and exposure to the arts is essential for all.  Arts For The Schools fills the gaps in visual and performing arts education for more than 10,000 children at K thru 12 schools AND provides access to artistic excellence for the public. For 34 years Arts For The Schools has encouraged children and adults to create, perform, learn, lead, understand and discover.

Outlandish Experiences carefully selects guides to provide bite sized activities that inspire travelers with authentic experiences in nature, in town, and beyond. Nevada City and Grass Valley are teaming with artists, foodies, musicians, healing arts practitioners, outdoor guides, farmers, spiritualists, writers, poets, freaks, geeks, and professional thrill seekers.
Paul Emery is a musician, producer and audio engineer.  For 41 years he has been producing concerts and gatherings that create unforgettable moments for both the performers and attendees.

The Penn Valley Community Rodeo Association is a non profit corporation, founded in 2005 to promote the sport of rodeo in Penn Valley, and to preserve the western lifestyle. The PVCRA benefits local schools and service clubs. PVCRA awards two scholarships each year to students in Agriculture.

Quest is committed to enlivening our community through actively increasing awareness of Nevada County to communities all over Northern California. Quest produces the annual Nugget Fringe Theater Festival and provides periodic acting workshops.

Since its first days, the promise of Sierra College has been to facilitate learning, inspire change, and build community. The College continues this mission as it adapts to meet the ever changing needs of students while promoting learning as a lifelong process.

Since its first days, the promise of Sierra College has been to facilitate learning, inspire change, and build community. The College continues this mission as it adapts to meet the ever-changing needs of students while promoting learning as a lifelong process.
Whether young or old, a beginner or advanced dancer, we offer dance unique methods of dance training that will help you take your dancing to new heights.

At Sierra Dance Institute, we offer a wide variety of dance classes for adults, teens, and children in a fun & vibrant atmosphere. We are located at the Grass Valley Center for the Arts in historic downtown Grass Valley.

Alasdair Fraser's Sierra Fiddle Camp in northern California at Shady Creek Camp on the San Juan Ridge (near Nevada City) invites you to a week of intensive study, recreation, and good times with people who share an interest in the music and dance traditions of Scotland and beyond

Our mission is to pass on the uniquely American tradition of jazz with the highest musical standards. Bill Douglass and the professional faculty share their knowledge and musical passion through annual summer Jazz Camp, concerts and workshops. Sierra Jazz Society, SJS, provides musical experiences that weave together the elements of jazz. Improvisation and discipline are basic and we combine them in an atmosphere of relaxed camaraderie and sympathetic communication.

properties.Organization: Sierra Master Chorale/InConcert Sierra-Twin Cities Concert Association
properties.Mission: InConcert Sierra presents exceptional classical and choral performances that inspire and enhance our cultural life. We offer a warm, inclusive community for enjoying music and we provide educational opportunities for youth and adults.

Our mission is to enrich the cultural life of Nevada County by providing high quality, affordable and accessible performances for everyone. Over the past ten years, we have presented 36 productions of plays and musicals utilizing local talent onstage and behind the scenes at our community’s leading performing arts venues.

Sierra Theaters is a locally owned, family business that operates Sierra Cinemas, The Del Oro Theatre, Sutton Cinemas, and The Nevada Theatre Film Series. Each theatre features comfortable seats, friendly staff, and state of the art projection and sound.  The popcorn is delicious, too!

Stellar Arts Foundation continues to be dedicated to assisting disadvantaged orphaned and Roma children in Eastern Europe. We at SAF believe in global cultural and arts exchange to preserve and help old cultures and traditions.

Tahoe Regional Arts Foundation is a 501(c)3 non profit organization dedicated to designing, funding, constructing, operating, and sustaining a state-of-the art visual and performing arts venue that will inspire and entertain residents, attract visitors, and educate area youth.

The Tahoe Truckee School of Music offers an opportunity in our community for learning and sharing music. We encourage those who are new to music as well as those who are experienced musicians. We focus on an environment that serves as a positive outlet not only for learning, but creativity, fun and interaction with others. We create and share music

The Curious Forge is a nonprofit 501(c)3 and LLC MakerSpace located at 13024 Bitney Springs Rd in Nevada City, California. With over 20,000 sq feet of space, members have access to training and a wide variety of over $100,000 in equipment from traditional to advanced. Most of all we are a community of builders, tinkerers, artists and professionals who love to make. Think of it as a artistic, technical and industrial playground.
As a full service production company we can provide for all your video needs.

Trails & Vistas' mission is to create community by celebrating the arts and nature. We facilitate art events in nature for people of all ages to promote an appreciation of the performing and visual arts, long lasting environmental stewardship, and create relationships between the artists, the attendees and the local and world community.
Truckee Arts Alliance represents the voice and clearinghouse for arts and culture in the Truckee community.

properties.Address: 11260 Donner Pass Rd, Ste C1, PMB 306
properties.Mission: The mission of Truckee Community Theater is to create opportunities for community participation in theatrical offerings of the highest possible quality presented to audiences at affordable prices.  We are dedicated to providing theatrical training to residents of all ages through plays, workshops, camps, and classes, to offer arts education that promotes life long learning, to collaborate with other local arts organizations, and to celebrate the power of theater to illuminate our common humanity.

Dance is our passion, our business, our life and it is our goal to inspire others to grow their own passion for the art of dance.  We strive to nurture each and every student and to give them the physical, mental and emotional tools to uncover their full potential as dancers and artists.  Truckee Dance Factory promotes strong self confidence, self-respect, discipline and commitment.  We encourage each dancer to find their own creativity and vision in order to excel in their art.
TPAC, the Truckee Public Art Commission, focuses on creating opportunities for public art, installation art, exhibits, and art events for the Community.
The roundhouse is a non profit makerspace that supports the teaching, learning, and practicing of a wide variety of crafts skills, technologies and arts in the Truckee Tahoe  community.

properties.Organization: Truckee Tahoe Community Chorus  Sierra College Campus
properties.Mission: The mission of the Truckee Tahoe Community Chorus is to perform a wide range of quality choral works that will appeal to the diverse community members of the Truckee and North Lake Tahoe region. TTCC is dedicated to building, nurturing and promoting a strong choral musical arts program in the schools and within the community.
The reading series where Sierra foothills literature lovers gather to celebrate the written word.
Formed in 2017 as a profit sharing collective, we are experienced theatre makers who have previously worked together many times. Come see our shows!

properties.Organization: Community Asian Theatre of the Sierra (CATS)
properties.Mission: The Community Asian Theatre of the Sierra (CATS), a 501c(3) public benefits charitable corporation, promotes diversity through the arts through multicultural theater, events and workshops.
